Class Towers

  • java.lang.Object
    • Towers

  • public class Towers
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Towers(int numRings)
      constructs a Towers object with three pegs, initializing the first peg with the specified number of rings, the othere two towers start with 0 rings.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Towers

        public Towers(int numRings)
        constructs a Towers object with three pegs, initializing the first peg with the specified number of rings, the othere two towers start with 0 rings. Precondition: 1 <= numRings <= 64. Postcondition: The towers have been initialized with numRings on the first peg and no rings on the other two pegs. The diameters of the first peg's rings are from one inch (on the top) to numRings inches (on the bottom).
        Parameters:
        numRings - The number of rings to initialize the first peg.

    • Method Detail

      • countRings

        public int countRings(int pegNumber)
        Returns the number of rings on the specified peg. Precondition: pegNumber is 1, 2, or 3 Postcondition: The return value is the number of rings on the specified peg.
        Parameters:
        pegNumber - The number of the peg 1 2 or 3..
        Returns:
        The number of rings on the specified peg.

      • getTopDiameter

        public int getTopDiameter(int pegNumber)
        Returns the diameter of the top ring on the specified peg. Precondition: pegNumber is 1, 2, or 3 Postcondition: If countRings(pegNumber) > 0, then the return value is the diameter of the top ring on the specified peg; otherwise, the return value is zero.
        Parameters:
        pegNumber - The number of the peg 1 2 or 3.
        Returns:
        The diameter of the top ring on the specified peg.

      • move

        public void move(int startPeg,
                 int endPeg)
        Moves the top ring from the start peg to the end peg. Precondition: stargPeg is a pegnumber (1, 2, or 3), and countRings(startPeg) > 0; endPeg is a different peg number (not equal to startPeg), and if endPeg has at least one ring, then getTopDiameter(startPeg) is less than getTopDiameter(endPeg). Postcondition: The top ring has been moved from startPeg to endPeg.
        Parameters:
        startPeg - The number of the peg 1, 2, or 3.
        endPeg - The number of the peg 1, 2, or 3.

      • displayTowers

        public void displayTowers()
        Displays the current state of the towers to the user. Precondition: the game has started Postcondition: a display indicating each peg and the stack of rings on each peg has been displayed with the smallest ring shown on top
